meta.title: Technology Support for At Home Learning - Wissahickon School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: Technology Support for At Home Learning - Wissahickon School District

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Technology Support for At Home Learning, Wissahickon School District
Technology Support for At Home Learning - Wissahickon School District
Technology Support for At Home Learning - Wissahickon School District

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasFooter fsHasTwoColumnWideRightLayout fsSection1448 fsHasTheme3

div.h3: True Blue with a Heart of Gold

li.a: Q&A Regarding COVID-19 Protocol at WSD
Technology Support for At Home Learning

main.h1: Technology Support for At Home Learning

div.p: Please follow these three (3) steps before submitting a support request.

ol.li: Restart your device. This does not mean Sleep or Shutdown.
Check that your device is not in airplane mode.
Check that the wireless connection is enabled.

ul.li:
Microsoft Office 365 & Teams (requires WSD credentials)
portal.office.com

div.p: The district uses many educational tools with students and staff. Many of these companies have been offering these tools to schools across the globe. This increased use is causing sporadic disruptions in service for free and paying customers. Please be aware that these issues are beyond the control of the WSD technology department. Exercise patience as the companies scale their hardware to accommodate the increase in daily users.
This list is periodically updated as new issues arise and resolved.

li.s: SeeSaw - Investigating - They've identified an issue where images are not loading in the feed. Users will see a blank white screen or a spinner. They are currently investigating.

ul.li: When accessing OneNote pages for new daily content, please stay on the tab for five minutes without 1) clicking off the page, 2) clicking other tabs, or 3) doing other work in other applications on the computer. After five minutes we are finding the new content will sync and appear for the page you are sitting on as well as other pages that have been updated by the teacher.

div.p: Our technology support team will provide assistance during regular workday hours, Monday through Friday 7:00 a.m. - 3:00 pm. We will work to respond to your requests as quickly as possible. We will do our best to support technical issues, but we cannot address hardware issues remotely, like broken screens and hardware crashes. Please understand that we may not be able to provide an immediate resolution with changes in state and local government restrictions.
Thank you for your patience as we embark on all new procedures and process to support our users remotely.

During this time while our school district is supporting at home learning, the most effective way to reach out for technology support is outlined below. Please note that help desk phone extension is not in service at this time.

p.strong: In your request, please provide as much information as you can about your problem so that we may expedite the solution.
p.span: NOTE: Students should know their usernames and passwords for online resources. If you need login assistance, please contact your student's teacher - do NOT submit a help desk request.

div.p: Students in Grades K-5: Parents/Guardians should use the Technology Support Online Form.
Students in Grades 6-12: Click here to open a help desk ticket
WSD employees: Click here to open a help desk ticket Please include your personal contact information (i.e. cell or home phone number) so that we can reach you if needed.

Please complete the form below to request a laptop for your child. Please note there is a limited supply of laptops so please only request a laptop if you really need it. If the District has enough laptops to meet the requests, you will be contacted when the laptop is ready.

The Wissahickon School District is committed to providing material on its website that is accessible to our students, families, staff and general public. If you experience difficulty with the accessibility of any material on our website, please visit our accessibility web page and complete the contact form to request our materials in an alternate format.

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window
